snippet: The Supreme Court on Wednesday ordered officials in Hawaii not to count ballots or name the winners in an election there until a federal appeals court rules on whether it was constitutional to limit voting to people of native Hawaiian ancestry.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court on Wednesday ordered officials in Hawaii not to count ballots or name the winners in an election there until a federal appeals court rules on whether it was constitutional to limit voting to people of native Hawaiian ancestry.

headline.main: Supreme Court Orders Delay in Hawaii Vote Count
headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Orders Delay In Hawaii Vote Count
